title: Scaling limit of domino tilings on a pentagonal domain
abstract:
We consider the six-vertex model at its free-fermion point with domain wall
boundary conditions, which is equivalent to random domino tilings of the Aztec
diamond. We compute the scaling limit of a particular non-local correlation
function, essentially equivalent to the partition function for the domino
tilings of a pentagon-shaped domain, obtained by cutting away a triangular
region from a corner of the initial Aztec diamond. We observe a third-order
phase transition when the geometric parameters of the obtained pentagonal
domain are tuned to have the fifth side exactly tangent to the arctic ellipse
of the corresponding initial model.
